trans-unit.source: Exposes the public members of the <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> class to unmanaged code.
This interface is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
This interface preserves the vtable order of the <xref:System.Exception?displayProperty=fullName> class members that can be accessed by unmanaged COM objects.
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Object.Equals(System.Object)"></xref> method.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method determines whether the specified <xref:System.Object> is equal to the current <xref:System.Object>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Exception.GetBaseException"></xref> method.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.GetBaseException%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method returns the <xref:System.Exception> that is the root cause of one or more subsequent exceptions.
The first exception thrown in a chain of exceptions.
If the <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref> property of the current exception is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), this property returns the current exception.
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Object.GetHashCode"></xref> method.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Object.GetHashCode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method serves as a hash function for a particular type.
<xref:System.Object.GetHashCode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
The hash code for the current instance.

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Exception.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> method
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.GetObjectData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method sets the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> object with information about the exception.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> structure that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Exception.GetType"></xref> method.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.GetType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method gets the runtime type of the current instance.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> object that represents the exact runtime type of the current instance.
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Exception.HelpLink"></xref> property.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.HelpLink%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets or sets a link to the help file associated with this exception.
The Uniform Resource Name (URN) or Uniform Resource Locator (URL) to a help file.
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref> property.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets the <xref:System.Exception> instance that caused the current exception.
An instance of <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that describes the error that caused the current exception.

The <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref> property returns the same value that was passed to the constructor, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the inner exception value was not supplied to the constructor.
This property is read-only.
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Exception.Message"></xref> property.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets a message that describes the current exception.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception, or an empty string("").
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Exception.Source"></xref> property.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.Source%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets or sets the name of the application or the object that causes the error.
The name of the application or the object that causes the error.
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Exception.StackTrace"></xref> property.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.StackTrace%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets a string representation of the frames on the call stack at the time the current exception was thrown.
A string that describes the contents of the call stack, with the most recent method call appearing first.
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Exception.TargetSite"></xref> property.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.TargetSite%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets the method that throws the current exception.
The <xref href="System.Reflection.MethodBase"></xref> object that threw the current exception.
Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the <xref href="System.Exception.ToString"></xref> method.
This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.ToString%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method creates and returns a string representation of the current exception.
A string that represents the current <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> object.
